title: Product Bulk Upload Guide
author: Ekobol Product Team
image_caption: Manage hundreds of products efficiently with CSV bulk operations.
intro: Save countless hours by uploading, editing, or deleting hundreds of products at once using CSV files. This guide covers everything from template download to error handling.
p1: Bulk upload allows you to manage large product catalogs efficiently by using CSV (Comma-Separated Values) files. Instead of adding products one by one, you can prepare a spreadsheet with all your product data and import it in seconds.
li1_text: Initial catalog setup - uploading 50+ products when first starting with Ekobol
li2_text: Seasonal inventory refresh - replacing entire product lines
li3_text: Price updates - changing prices across multiple products simultaneously
li4_text: Stock adjustments - updating inventory levels after physical count
li5_text: Marketplace migrations - importing products from other platforms
p2: Always start with Ekobol's official CSV template to ensure compatibility and avoid validation errors.
li7_text: Click the 'Bulk Actions' button in the top toolbar
li8_text: Select 'Download CSV Template' from the dropdown
li9_text: Choose your template type: 'New Products' or 'Update Existing Products'
li10_text: Save the file to your computer
p3: The template includes all required columns with example data in the first row. Do not delete the header row.

p5: Follow these best practices to ensure a smooth import:
li11_text: Use UTF-8 encoding to support special characters and emojis
li12_text: Avoid commas in text fields (use semicolons or pipes instead)
li13_text: Ensure SKUs are unique - duplicates will cause errors
li14_text: Price values should use decimal points (29.99), not commas
li15_text: Stock quantity must be whole numbers (no decimals)
li16_text: Remove any empty rows - they will be skipped but slow processing
li17_text: Use HTTPS URLs only (HTTP will be rejected)
li18_text: Supported formats: JPG, PNG, WEBP, GIF
li20_text: Separate multiple URLs with commas (no spaces)
p6: Once your CSV is ready, the upload process is straightforward:
li24_text: Drag and drop your file or click 'Browse' to select it
li25_text: Review the file preview showing the first 5 rows
p7: Ekobol will display a real-time progress bar. For large files (1000+ products), this may take several minutes. Do not close your browser tab during import.
p8: Ekobol validates every row before importing. If errors are found, you'll see a detailed error report.
error1_desc: SKU already exists in your catalog. Use 'Update' mode or change the SKU.
error2_desc: Required columns (SKU, Title, Price, Stock) cannot be empty.
error3_desc: Price must be a positive number with max 2 decimal places.
error4_desc: Image URL returned 404 or timeout. Check URL validity.
error5_desc: Category path doesn't match your catalog structure.
p9: If any rows fail, Ekobol generates an error CSV with:
p10: Fix the errors in the CSV and re-upload. Successfully imported rows will be skipped automatically.
p11: To update existing products, use the 'Update Mode' and ensure your CSV includes the SKU column. Ekobol will match products by SKU and update only the columns you provide. Empty columns will be ignored (existing data preserved).
li30_text: Download current product data via 'Export Products to CSV'
li31_text: Modify only the columns you want to change
p12: To delete multiple products at once:
li33_text: Create a CSV with a single column: 'SKU'
li34_text: List all SKUs you want to delete (one per row)
li36_text: Confirm deletion in the warning dialog
p13_warning: Warning: Bulk delete is permanent and cannot be undone. Always backup your data before bulk deletions.
p14: If your CSV has 10,000+ products, split it into smaller chunks (2,000 rows each) to avoid timeouts and make error handling easier.
p15: Leverage Excel formulas to generate SKUs, calculate prices, or format data before export. Just remember to save as CSV, not XLSX.
p16: For recurring imports, consider using Ekobol's Bulk Upload API endpoint. See the API Integration Guide for details.
help_text: Need more help with CSV imports? Check out our video tutorial or contact support.
